resources.string: When notifications are annoying you or disturbing at work, just turn on screen and you can flip your phone (facing the back of the phone upwards) and this app will do the same.
This app allows your phone to get one of the useful features from Google Pixel 3 i.e\n\'Flip-to-Shhh\'.\nIt enables the \'Do not Disturb\' when you flip your phone.
Tap below to enable this feature.
We need the \'Do not Disturb\' access permission in order to enable this feature.
Your device will vibrate within 1 – 3 seconds once it detects that it is \'flipped\'

You can add quick toggle tile
to easily toggle to on or off the feature in the quick settings panel.
Edit your panel to add the tile.
It's symbol look like this …
This is the actual default Pixel feature to detect and enable DND (Do Not Disturb) when the device is flipped facing the back of it upwards.

In this setting, just flip once anywhere and DND will be enabled.
Flip once again and you've disabled DND :) Try to make device as flat as possible while flipping for better detection.

Definitely don't forget to turn ON screen before flipping. The DND would not go off unless you flip again or you manually turn it off.
*The type of option you choose, those notifications will be filtered and shown to you when DND is enabled.
We are testing your accelerometer first. Keep your device on a flat surface and press the \'Start\' button.
Before continuing to use this app, you\'re required to test your sensor if it is working correctly.\nThank you.
Now move your device a bit and see the value below changing. Keep your device flat after 2–3 seconds. After 5–10 seconds, your device will vibrate once testing is completed.

Your proximity sensor should be on the above chin of your deivce. Place your on the proximity sensor and remove several times to see the value below changing. Once you have changed it more than 5 times, test is completed
Now we will test your proximity sensor. Before continuing, make sure you know where your proximity sensor is located. You can still try if you are not sure.
